title: What Are People Asking About {COVID-19}? A Question Classification Dataset
authors:
Wei, Jerry  and
Huang, Chengyu  and
Vosoughi, Soroush  and
Wei, Jason
venue: Proceedings of the 1st Workshop on {NLP} for {COVID-19} at {ACL} 2020
abstract: We present COVID-Q, a set of 1,690 questions about COVID-19 from 13 sources, which we annotate into 15 question categories and 207 question clusters. The most common questions in our dataset asked about transmission, prevention, and societal effects of COVID, and we found that many questions that appeared in multiple sources were not answered by any FAQ websites of reputable organizations such as the CDC and FDA. We post our dataset publicly athttps://github.com/JerryWei03/COVID-Q. For classifying questions into 15 categories, a BERT baseline scored 58.1% accuracy when trained on 20 examples per category, and for a question clustering task, a BERT + triplet loss baseline achieved 49.5% accuracy. We hope COVID-Q can help either for direct use in developing applied systems or as a domain-specific resource for model evaluation.
